mongodbDatabaseArticles.content:
20 Goals That I Must Achieve in 2013

20 Goals that I Must Achieve by 11:59 PM December 31, 2013

As we settle into our new lives here in Chiang Mai, Thailand, I have established a list of things that I would like to achieve before the year is over. Some for fun, others to become a better person, and the rest to develop this blog into a tool of inspiration for others while opening up doors to greater opportunities for me and Angela. I hope my list wakes you up a little and motivates you to take a couple of steps forward in your life. We sometimes forget how complacent we can often become when we fall into life’s little mundane routines. Even changes that seem insignificant or simple can have a profound impact on the course we take in our lives. Here is to changing things up a bit.

Personal Goals to Achieve

  • Surprise Angela with something nice that tips the scales of epicness

  • Teach Angela how to ride a motorbike

  • Participate in a meaningful one week on site volunteer program

  • Pay for a stranger’s order at Mrs. Pa’s Fruit Shake Stand once a week

  • Have a stranger pay for my order as my new trend catches on

  • Learn how to read, write, and speak beginner level Thai

  • Develop my photography skills to a competent level

  • Strictly adhere to our $1,200 USD a month budget

  • Run the perimeter of the Chiang Mai moat

  • Do 100 six count push up burpees in a single workout

Blog Goals to Achieve

  • Write two thought provoking and inspiring blog posts a week

  • Write a guest post on a prominent travel blog

  • Convince a prominent travel blogger to write a guest post on our blog

  • Reach 1,000 Facebook likes

  • Reach 500 Twitter followers

  • Take an Instagram photo that receives 150 likes

  • Create a YouTube video that receives 5,000 views

  • Inspire a good friend to quit their job and travel

  • Be recognized in the street by a random stranger that follows our blog

  • Expand on my SEO knowledge and implementation

BONUS

  • Consume a Carlsberg Royal Stout Beer in Chiang Mai, Thailand, which could be quite the task given this review and my inability to find one by now

 Goals appear in no particular order. I will keep you all up to date!
